Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug] Stats: Community Packages shows non-Community Packages #3" (#9772) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug



The Community Packages shows non-Community Packages. 

### Repro Steps

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. go to https://www.nuget.org/stats/packages


### Expected Behavior

Not showing Microsoft packages when "Show all packages" isn't checked. Currently multiple microsoft.* packages are shown


### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Related #8456, https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7314

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Wrong version in API V3" (#10164) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

Other

### Describe the bug

in api v3 latest stable version 3.2.3
on [SqlKata](https://www.nuget.org/packages/SqlKata/) 2.4.0

### Repro Steps

https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/sqlkata/index.json
```
{
    "versions": [
        "1.0.0-beta-1",
      ...
        "2.4.0",
        "3.0.0-beta",
        "3.2.3"
    ]
}
```

### Expected Behavior

need:
```
{
    "versions": [
        "1.0.0-beta-1",
      ...
        "2.4.0",
        "3.0.0-beta",
    ]
}
```

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet Error: Unable to parse version value '2.0.0-beta.3' from 'packages.config" (#13750) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
# Issue Transfer

This issue has been transferred from the Azure SDK for .NET repository, [#45718](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-net/issues/45718).

### Please be aware that @limdv is the author of the original issue and include them for any questions or replies.

## Details

Hello,

After I installed Azure.AI.OpenAI 2.0.0-beta.3 I receive the following build errors. Anyone else seen and been able to resolve this issue. I can't seem to find any information regarding this error and it may not be specific to this package. It seems to be any package with 4 segments in the version. Any idea how to fix this?

>C:\Projects\SMTMVC\.nuget\nuget.targets(92,9): error : Unable to parse version value '2.0.0-beta.3' from 'packages.config'.
3>C:\Projects\SMTMVC\.nuget\nuget.targets(92,9): error MSB3073: The command ""C:\Projects\SMTMVC\.nuget\NuGet.exe" install "C:\Projects\SMTMVC\SMTMVC\packages.config" -source ""  -NonInteractive -RequireConsent -solutionDir "C:\Projects\SMTMVC\ "" exited with code 1.

### Environment

MVC project targeting the .NET Framework 4.8 in Visual Studio 2022 (Version 17.11.0), Nuget Package Manager (Version 6.11.0).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Navigation telemetry for hyperlinks: License, ReportAbuse, Readme, ProjectUrl" (#13749) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Enable the navigation telemetry in the Details Pane for existing hyperlinks:
1. License
2. ReportAbuse
3. Readme
4. ProjectUrl

While adding Owner Profile telemetry in https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/13738, I found that these were not emitting events as they were not setup correctly, and I decided to quickly enable them. It may be interesting to know which hyperlinks are used most commonly.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "When a source isn't accessible, service index cannot be read issues suppress the internal message making it difficult to understand the root cause" (#12530) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Create a project with the following content. 

Restore it.

```csproj
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net8.0</TargetFramework>
    <ImplicitUsings>enable</ImplicitUsings>
    <Nullable>enable</Nullable>
    <RestoreSources>https://api.nuget.org/v3/indexss.json</RestoreSources>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="nuget.common" version="6.6.0" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

> C:\Code\ServiceIndex\ServiceIndex.csproj : error NU1301: Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/indexss.json.

The error message on detailed verbosity is not any better. It's very apparent here that some exceptions are being swallowed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NU1503 Warning documentation is lacking information" (#13748) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

dotnet 8.0.304, MSBuild 17.10.4.21802

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

- Create a Sdk from scratch that do not import a standard one (my example is an ePub generation based on markdown files)
- Define all targets that are supposed to exist (Clean, Restore, Build, VSTest,  Publish, Pack ...)
- Build a solution containing one of such project that uses this Sdk
- You get a warning
```
... warning NU1503: Skipping restore for project '....epubproj'. The project file may be invalid or missing targets required for restore.
``` 
- Go to the doc about [NU1503](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/errors-and-warnings/nu1503)

Neither the warning message nor the documentation page indicate which targets are expected to exist.
A search gave [this StackOverflow page](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59785046/skipping-restore-for-project-setupwix-wixproj-the-project-file-may-be-invalid) in which it is said that both **Restore** and **_IsProjectRestoreSupported** must exist.
The is of course the missing bit.
The propsed answer of m0sa is correct and should be part of the documentation.
```html
 <!-- prevents NU1503 -->
  <Target Name="_IsProjectRestoreSupported"
          Returns="@(_ValidProjectsForRestore)">
    <ItemGroup>
      <_ValidProjectsForRestore Include="$(MSBuildProjectFullPath)" />
    </ItemGroup>
  </Target>
  <Target Name="Restore">
    ...
  </Target>
``` 

### Verbose Logs

```shell
This is a doc problem, so no log.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Wrong version in API V3" (#13747) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Wrong version in API V3" (#13747) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Version conflict with Nuget.Frameworks.dll in .Net SDK 8.0.401" (#13746) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

.NET SDK 8.0.401

### Worked before?

.NET SDK 8.0.304

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

We are using MSBuild in our project. There is a version conflict with newest .Net 8 SDK (8.0.401) which comes with Visual Studio because of Nuget.Framworks.dll. We are using Nuget.Frameworks.dll from the nuget.org with version 6.11.0.119, SDK uses 6.11.0.122 which is not available on nuget.org.
The version conflict happened, after updating Visual Studio from 17.10.x to 17.11.x (with SDK update from 8.0.3xx to 8.0.4xx). Search for new version on Nuget.org not succesfull. SDK version not available on nuget.org. Manual project reference to nuget.frameworks assembly of SDK no solution for us.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'NuGet.Frameworks, Version=6.11.0.122, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'. Could not find or load a specific file. (0x80131621)
File name: 'NuGet.Frameworks, Version=6.11.0.122, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'
 ---> System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'NuGet.Frameworks, Version=6.11.0.122, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'.
   at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.LoadFromAssemblyPath(String assemblyPath)
   at Microsoft.Build.Shared.MSBuildLoadContext.Load(AssemblyName assemblyName)
   at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.ResolveUsingLoad(AssemblyName assemblyName)
   at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.Resolve(IntPtr gchManagedAssemblyLoadContext, AssemblyName assemblyName)
   at Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks.ProcessFrameworkReferences.<>c.<AddPacksForFrameworkReferences>b__217_0(ITaskItem item)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "An item with the same key has already been added restoring in Visual Studio when two projects have the same name" (#13745) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

VS17.11

### Worked before?

yes, maybe 17.10, maybe 17.8

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

see: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Cannot-nuget-restore-after-updating-visu/10696231#T-N10714249-N10730661

Two projects in two "solution folders" have the same name: Test
Visual Studio's error list has the error: "Error occurred while restoring NuGet packages: An item with the same key has already been added"

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Navigation telemetry for Owner Profile URLs in PM UI" (#13738) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Enable the navigation telemetry so we can track usage of the Owner Profile URL feature on the PM UI Packages List and the Details Pane.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Collect telemetry for HTTPS sources with HTTP resources" (#13744) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Collect telemetry for HTTPS sources with HTTP resources in their service index

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add msbuild extension point after Directory.Packages.props is imported" (#13743) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Define an msbuild extension point to be able to import msbuild logic directly after the Directory.Packages.props file gets imported.

This mimics the extension point that already exists for Directory.Packages.props: https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/blob/07a6d0d9cd3515987587b34dd8171c5c7372dcd9/src/Tasks/Microsoft.Common.props#L36

This is useful as source-build updates the Version metadata on the PackageVersion items to lift dependencies to a live built version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).
